parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of metadata entity.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The version of the API to be used with the client request.

id.description: The resource Id of the metadata entity.

type.description: The type of the metadata entity.

name.description: The name of the metadata entity.

dependsOn.description: The list of keys on which this entity depends on.

applicableScenarios.description: The list of scenarios applicable to this metadata entity.

id.description: The id.

get.summary: Gets the list of metadata entities.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
The filter to apply to the recommendation metadata.
Filter can be applied to properties ['[recommendationCategory](#category)', '[recommendationSubCategory](#recommendationSubCategory)', 'RetirementDate'] with operators ['eq', 'and', 'le', 'ge']
The filter can also be applied to property ['[TrackingIds]']

⚠ **Note:** `recommendationControl` is a legacy filter property and will be deprecated in the future. Please use `recommendationSubCategory` for filtering recommendation subcategory.

Valid options for recommendationSubCategory: ['BusinessContinuity', 'DisasterRecovery', 'HighAvailability', 'MonitoringAndAlerting', 'Other', 'Personalized', 'PrioritizedRecommendations', 'Scalability', 'ServiceUpgradeAndRetirement', 'Validation']

Example:
- $filter=recommendationCategory eq 'HighAvailability' and recommendationSubCategory eq 'ServiceUpgradeAndRetirement' and retirementDate ge '2024-01-01' and retirementDate le '2028-01-01'. Filter can be applied on trackingIds as well.
- $filter=trackingIds/any(t: t eq 'some-guid')

⚠ **Note:** `trackingIDs` filter can be used for filtering one value at a time. The support to filter multiple values is not currently available. Also the support to add other filters along with `trackingIDs` is not available.

id.description: The resource Id of the metadata entity.

type.description: The type of the metadata entity.

name.description: The name of the metadata entity.

dependsOn.description: The list of keys on which this entity depends on.

applicableScenarios.description: The list of scenarios applicable to this metadata entity.

id.description: The id.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of metadata.

get.description: Retrieve Azure Advisor configurations and also retrieve configurations of contained resource groups.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The Azure subscription ID.

200.description: OK. Successfully retrieved zero or more configurations.

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. E.g. "/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}"

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

exclude.description: Exclude the resource from Advisor evaluations. Valid values: False (default) or True.

lowCpuThreshold.description: Minimum percentage threshold for Advisor low CPU utilization evaluation. Valid only for subscriptions. Valid values: 5 (default), 10, 15 or 20.

duration.description: Minimum duration for Advisor low CPU utilization evaluation. Valid only for subscriptions. Valid values: 7 (default), 14, 21, 30, 60 or 90.

digests.description: Advisor digest configuration. Valid only for subscriptions

name.description: Name of digest configuration. Value is case-insensitive and must be unique within a subscription.

actionGroupResourceId.description: Action group resource id used by digest.

frequency.description: Frequency that digest will be triggered, in days. Value must be between 7 and 30 days inclusive.

categories.description: Categories to send digest for. If categories are not provided, then digest will be sent for all categories.

language.description: Language for digest content body. Value must be ISO 639-1 code for one of Azure portal supported languages. Otherwise, it will be converted into one. Default value is English (en).

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of configurations.

put.description: Create/Overwrite Azure Advisor configuration and also delete all configurations of contained resource groups.

post.description: Initiates the recommendation generation or computation process for a subscription. This operation is asynchronous. The generated recommendations are stored in a cache in the Advisor service.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The Azure subscription ID.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The version of the API to be used with the client request.

202.description: Accepted. Recommendation generation has been accepted.

Location.description: The URL where the status of the asynchronous operation can be checked.

Retry-After.description: The amount of delay to use while the status of the operation is checked. The value is expressed in seconds.

get.description: Retrieves the status of the recommendation computation or generation process. Invoke this API after calling the generation recommendation. The URI of this API is returned in the Location field of the response header.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The Azure subscription ID.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: The operation ID, which can be found from the Location field in the generate recommendation response header.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The version of the API to be used with the client request.

202.description: Accepted. Recommendation generation is in progress.

204.description: NoContent. Recommendation generation has been completed.

get.description: Obtains cached recommendations for a subscription. The recommendations are generated or computed by invoking generateRecommendations.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The Azure subscription ID.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
The filter to apply to the recommendations.
Filter can be applied to properties ['ResourceId', 'ResourceGroup', 'RecommendationTypeGuid', '[Category](#category)', 'SubCategory', 'RetirementDate'] with operators ['eq', 'and', 'or', 'lt', 'gt', 'le', 'ge'].

⚠ **Note:** `Control` is a legacy filter property and will be deprecated in the future. Please use `SubCategory` for filtering recommendation subcategory.

Valid options for SubCategory:
['BusinessContinuity', 'DisasterRecovery', 'HighAvailability', 'MonitoringAndAlerting', 'Other', 'Personalized', 'PrioritizedRecommendations', 'Scalability', 'ServiceUpgradeAndRetirement', 'Validation']

Example:
- $filter=Category eq 'Cost' and ResourceGroup eq 'MyResourceGroup'
-$filter=SubCategory eq 'ServiceUpgradeAndRetirement' and RetirementDate le '2024-01-01' and RetirementDate ge '2028-01-01'

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The number of recommendations per page if a paged version of this API is being used.

parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: The page-continuation token to use with a paged version of this API.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of recommendations.

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. E.g. "/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}"

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

impact.description: The business impact of the recommendation.

impactedField.description: The resource type identified by Advisor.

lastUpdated.description: The most recent time that Advisor checked the validity of the recommendation.

risk.description: The potential risk of not implementing the recommendation.

problem.description: The issue or opportunity identified by the recommendation and proposed solution.

solution.description: The issue or opportunity identified by the recommendation and proposed solution.

suppressionIds.description: The list of snoozed and dismissed rules for the recommendation.

resourceMetadata.description: Metadata of resource that was assessed

resourceId.description: Azure resource Id of the assessed resource

source.description: Source from which recommendation is generated

singular.description: The singular user friendly name of resource type. eg: virtual machine

plural.description: The plural user friendly name of resource type. eg: virtual machines

learnMoreLink.description: The link to learn more about recommendation and generation logic.

potentialBenefits.description: The potential benefit of implementing recommendation.

actions.description: The list of recommended actions to implement recommendation.

remediation.description: The automated way to apply recommendation.

exposedMetadataProperties.description: The recommendation metadata properties exposed to customer to provide additional information.

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

exclude.description: Exclude the resource from Advisor evaluations. Valid values: False (default) or True.

lowCpuThreshold.description: Minimum percentage threshold for Advisor low CPU utilization evaluation. Valid only for subscriptions. Valid values: 5 (default), 10, 15 or 20.

duration.description: Minimum duration for Advisor low CPU utilization evaluation. Valid only for subscriptions. Valid values: 7 (default), 14, 21, 30, 60 or 90.

digests.description: Advisor digest configuration. Valid only for subscriptions

name.description: Name of digest configuration. Value is case-insensitive and must be unique within a subscription.

actionGroupResourceId.description: Action group resource id used by digest.

frequency.description: Frequency that digest will be triggered, in days. Value must be between 7 and 30 days inclusive.

categories.description: Categories to send digest for. If categories are not provided, then digest will be sent for all categories.

language.description: Language for digest content body. Value must be ISO 639-1 code for one of Azure portal supported languages. Otherwise, it will be converted into one. Default value is English (en).

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of configurations.
